properties.name: Open Penguinos 16
properties.description: Check out Super Penguinos 16! üêß It's a fun and quick 2D platformer with 3 action-packed levels where you play as cute penguins collecting stars to progress. Big inspo from the old "Super Mario Bros: Star Scramble" fan game! Even with just 3 phases, each one's got challenges, enemies, and secrets to find. Jump, slide, and explore vibrant (albeit short!) worlds grabbing those stars to unlock the next stage. If you're looking for a short but sweet nostalgic adventure, this one's for you! Go collect those stars and show your skills in these 3 exciting levels! ‚ú®
properties.author: MiguelTheDRMR

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CharacterGameFeel
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add game feel to your platformer character object.
description: Add game feel behavior to your platformer character object to get the animations:
- **Idle:** gives your character breath animation while not moving.
- **Jump:** gives your character squash and stretch animation when jumping.
- **Fall:** gives your character stretch animation when falling.
- **Land:** gives your character squash and stretch animation when landing.
# Behavior
- Game feel behavior.
- Includes the options (Scale strength/Scaling speed) for every animation.
# Condition
- Animation is playing.
# Action
- Disable animation.
- Enable animation.
# Important
- In the events add the action [Separate player object from floor object] to avoid any kind of bugs.
![](https://i.imgur.com/TtdrAFp.png)
- Your sprite "origin" point, must be at the center bottom.
![](https://i.imgur.com/OdNv0cu.png)
- Your sprite bottom collision, must be filled entirely.
![](https://i.imgur.com/sHGOeqW.png)

events.comment: Boolean to check if the idle animation is unchecked in the behavior
Tween the object to its normal scale if its moving
Tween the object to first step of breathing animation
Tween the object to the second step of breathing animation (scaling back to 1)
Repeat when the breath animation has finished (loop)
Boolean to check if the jump animation is unchecked in the behavior
Tween the object to first step of jumping (squash)
Tween the object to second step of jumping (Stretch)
Tween back to object original scale
Boolean to give the ability to repeat after standing on floor
Boolean to check if the fall animation is unchecked in the behavior
Stretch the object when falling
If the land animation is unchecked, Tween the object to its normal scale
If the land animation is checked, give the ability to do the fall animation again
If the land animation is unchecked, give the ability to do the fall animation again after the tween
Boolean to check if the fall animation is unchecked in the behavior
Booleans to check if the object is landing
Squash the object when landing
Tween back to object original scale after squashing
Boolean to give the ability to do the land animation again

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera closer to _PARAM0_

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Do move the camera closer _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.sentence: Update forecasted position of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX)¬≤)
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY)¬≤)
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a¬≤ + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a¬≤ + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: This extension provides behaviors to:
* Jump in mid-air
* Jump and slide against walls
* Dash horizontally
* Dash toward the floor

* Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers).
It gives access to:
- button presses
- axis positions and force
- trigger pressure
- configurable deadzone
- vibration
- automatic mappers for platformer characters and top-down movement
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: GamePixSDK
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
The GamePix game SDK provides a series of utility methods needed for running your game in the GamePix ecosystem.
They enhance the user experience of your game and complete the integration with our ads network and revenues system.
description: The GamePix game SDK provides a series of utility methods needed for running your game in the GamePix ecosystem.
They enhance the user experience of your game and complete the integration with our ads network and revenues system.

This SDK provides a set of actions and conditions to display advertising on the GamePix publishing platform. You can use them without initialisation (initialisation is handled by the extension itself). If you run your build locally, you will get a warning that the GamePix player is not found, don't worry, it's OK, it means you are using the test SDK, which is ideal for debugging.
Events sheet for the **interstitial ad**:
* Please add "Show the interstitial ad" action whenever you want to show this ad.
* Add a condition "Check if interstitial has ended", it will be set to true when player closes the interstitial ad. When this condition is read, the status will be immediately reset to false.
Events sheet for **reward ad**:
* Add a "Show the reward ad" action whenever you want to show this ad.
* Add a condition "Check that the reward ad has ended", it will be set to true when the player closes the reward ad. When this condition is read, the status is immediately reset to false.

* Add a condition "Check if player should be rewarded" as a subevent of "Check that the reward ad has ended". It will be set to true if the player should be rewarded, otherwise it will be false. (This condition will always track the last result of the reward ad and will never reset.)
The **"Language"** expression can be used to retrieve the preferred language on the GamePix platform. It will only be available after the SDK has been initialised.
The **"GamePix SDK is being initialised"** condition can be used to check the status of SDK initialisation. It is set to true immediately after successful initialisation.
Events sheet example of GamePix SDK integration:
![Events sheet](https://gpx-porting.s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/docs/gamepix-sdk-gdevelop.png)
**Advanced Usage**
GamePix SDK provides following javascript API:
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.lang() - gets the current preferred language by the player
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension().langSync() - same as lang(), but will return null if SDK is not yet initialized
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.updateScore(score) - should be called immediately every time the current score is updated
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.updateLevel(level) - should be called to send the score after the player passed the level
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.happyMoment() - should be called when Happy Moment just happened
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.setItem(key, value) - persistently stores the value. The value must be a string
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.getItem(key) - read value from storage
* gdjs._gamePixSdkExtension.getItemSync(key) - same as getItem(), but will return null if SDK is not yet initialized
